case_vignette: A newborn fullterm female is noted to have a patch of hair loss, prominent leg veins, and shortened fingers at birth! Prenatal course was unremarkable! Physical examination reveals an extensive large ulcerated atrophic plaque on the scalp with surrounding peripheral hair, brachydactyly of index fingers, and lacy reticulated violaceous patches on the right thigh and calf!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a large patch on my scalp with missing hair and damaged skin, my index fingers are shorter than normal, and I have lace-like bluish patches on my right thigh and calf.
Have you ever been genetically tested or diagnosed with a genetic condition in the past?
No, I have not been genetically tested or diagnosed with a genetic condition in the past.
Do you have any family members with similar symptoms or any known genetic disorders?
No, I do not have any family members with similar symptoms or known genetic disorders.
Is the patch on your scalp associated with scaling or a possible fungal infection, and have you experienced any trauma to the area?
The patch on my scalp is not related to any fungal infection or trauma; it's an ulcerated and atrophic area with hair missing around it.
Do you have any other medical conditions, or are you currently taking any medications?
No, I do not have any other medical conditions nor am I taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Goltz Syndrome

trial_0.singleturn_frq: Final Diagnosis: Incontinentia Pigmenti Achromians (Hypomelanosis of Ito)
